hook.text: Falling water has powered mills for centuries. Now it generates 16% of the world's electricity.

buildup.text: A dam holds back a reservoir. Water flows through turbines at the base, spinning generators.

discovery.text: Hydro is reliable and produces almost no emissions once the dam is built.

twist.text: But dams flood valleys, displace communities, and block fish migration routes.

climax.text: Rotting vegetation in reservoirs can also release methane, especially in the tropics.

punchline.text: Clean power with a complicated price tag.

quiz.question: What share of global electricity comes from hydroelectric power?
